info.title: Introduction
info.description: The Events API provides access to create custom events.

post.description: Creates one event with the specified details.

400.description: Returned when invalid input has been provided. Fix the issue and retry.

401.description: Returned when access to the resource is unauthorized.

403.description: Returned when access is not allowed due to insufficient permissions.

404.description: Returned when the resource does not exist.

429.description: Returned when the client has exceeded the rate limit for this endpoint. A `Retry-After` header will be included with the response. This header will contain the number of seconds that you should wait before attempting to send another request.

example.message: Too many requests. Client has exceeded the rate limit for this endpoint.

500.description: Returned when a server error is encountered.

parameters.name: Idempotency-Key
parameters.description: Optional header for making the request idempotent

parameters.name: include_schema

example.message: User with that ID does not exist

message.description: Long form description of what went wrong

code.description: A short snake-cased value that is safe to handle programmatically

fullstory.v2.apierror.ErrorResponse.description: A structured error response from the server

timestamp.description: Optional. The event's timestamp represented in ISO 8601 format. If not provided, the current FullStory server time will be used.

schema.description: Optional. Schema declaration, to define the structure of the data, the schema will override FullStory's default type inference.

fullstory.v2.events.BrowserContext.description: The browser context in which the events are attached to.

fullstory.v2.events.Context.description: The context in which the events are attached to.

requests.description: The list of event requests that should be imported

shared.description: If there is any `shared` data from the original import request that may have caused conflict with data from within this event.

fullstory.v2.events.CreateBatchEventsImp.description: The request payloads contains the list of events to be imported

job.description: Information about the job that was initiated to import the list of events submitted.

timestamp.description: Optional. The event's timestamp represented in ISO 8601 format. If not provided, the current FullStory server time will be used. It is recommended to always set the timestamp.

schema.description: Optional. Schema declaration, to define the structure of the data, the schema will override FullStory's default type inference.

fullstory.v2.events.DeviceContext.description: The device context in which the events are attached to.

results.description: Page of events import failures for the batch import

total_records.description: The total number of failures for the specified events import

next_page_token.description: The token that can be used in a subsequent request to fetch the next page of import failures

fullstory.v2.events.GetBatchEventsImport.description: Server response for retrieving batch events import errors

message.description: A description of the failure encountered while importing the events.

event.description: The corresponding events import request that resulted in the failure.

shared.description: If there is any `shared` data from the original import request that may have caused conflict with data from within this event.

fullstory.v2.events.GetBatchEventsImport.description: Server response for failed batch events

results.description: Page of events import responses for the batch import

total_records.description: Total number of records in this batch import

next_page_token.description: The token that can be used in a subsequent request to fetch the next page of import results

fullstory.v2.events.GetBatchEventsImport.description: Server response for retrieving batch events imported

fullstory.v2.events.LocationContext.description: The location context in which the events are attached to.

fullstory.v2.events.MobileContext.description: The mobile context in which the events are attached to.

id.description: The FullStory generated identifier for the session to associate the event with.

use_most_recent.description:
Associate events with the most recent session captured from the user.

If set to `true`, a `user` is required. The user must have a session within the past 30 minutes, otherwise the events will be created for the user without a session.

It is recommended to use `session.id` instead, when creating events for a specific session.

id.description: The FullStory generated identifier for the session to associate the event with.

fullstory.v2.events.SessionIdResponse.description: The session identifier. If the event is attached to a session.

fullstory.v2.events.SharedData.description: Optional. Any shared context among all requests in the create batch events import job. If any of the events in the `requests` field also contain a context, the event will fail to be imported.

uid.description: The application-specific ID you've given to the user.

id.description: The FullStory-assigned user ID. This value is returned in a `POST /v2/users` (create user) response.

fullstory.v2.events.UserIdRequest.description:
The user identifier.

If `session.id` is provided, the `session.id` is enough to identify a session for which to create the event, and `user` will not be accepted.

If `session.use_most_recent` is set to `true`, one and only one`user` field is required.

finished.description: Time the job was finished, either successfully or unsuccessfully.

fullstory.v2.job.JobMetadata.description: JobMetadata contains metadata about asynchronous jobs.
fullstory.v2.job.JobMetadata.title: JobMetadata

fullstory.v2.job.JobStatus.description:
- PROCESSING: Indicates that the job has been accepted by FullStory and is being processed.
 - COMPLETED: Indicates that the job has been completed successfully without any errors.
 - FAILED: Indicates that the job has failures, including partial failures.

imports.description: The stats on the number of items imported successfully

errors.description: Only included for failed imports. The stats on the number of items that failed to be imported

job.description: Information about the current state of the job

fullstory.v2.job.JobStatusResponse.description: Server response for the job status

properties.description: A mapping of field names to their corresponding types.

google.protobuf.NullValue.description:
`NullValue` is a singleton enumeration to represent the null value for the
`Value` type union.

 The JSON representation for `NullValue` is JSON `null`.

 - NULL_VALUE: Null value.

ApiKeyAuth.description: The HTTP API requires an API key that you can generate from the FullStory app. The API key must have Admin or Architect level permissions for requests which retrieve data. The header value takes the form "Basic {YOUR_API_KEY}".
ApiKeyAuth.name: Authorization
